1#!/usr/bin/env python3 

2""" 

3HyperCode Project Scaffolder 

4Automatically creates the complete project structure cross-platform 

5 

6Usage: python scaffold.py 

7 

8This script creates: 

9- All required directories 

10- All necessary files with proper structure 

11- Starter content for key files 

12""" 

13 

14import os 

15import stat 

16import sys 

17from datetime import datetime 

18from pathlib import Path 

19 

20# Project metadata 

21PROJECT_NAME = "hypercode" 

22AUTHOR = "welshDog (Lyndz Williams)" 

23AUTHOR_EMAIL = "hello@hypercode.dev" 

24VERSION = "0.1.0" 

25LICENSE = "MIT" 

26DESCRIPTION = ( 

27 "HyperCode: Neurodivergent-First Programming Language with AI Compatibility" 

28) 

29 

30# Define the complete project structure 

31PROJECT_STRUCTURE = { 

32 # Core language modules 

33 "core": { 

34 "files": [ 

35 "__init__.py", 

36 "lexer.py", 

37 "parser.py", 

38 "semantic_analyzer.py", 

39 "optimizer.py", 

40 "cli.py", 

41 ], 

42 "description": "Core HyperCode language implementation", 

43 }, 

44 # Compilation backends 

45 "backends": { 

46 "files": [ 

47 "__init__.py", 

48 "javascript.py", 

49 "python.py", 

50 "wasm.py", 

51 "quantum.py", 

52 "dna.py", 

53 ], 

54 "description": "Multi-backend compilation targets", 

55 }, 

56 # AI model integration 

57 "ai_gateway": { 

58 "files": [ 

59 "__init__.py", 

60 "base_gateway.py", 

61 "openai_adapter.py", 

62 "claude_adapter.py", 

63 "mistral_adapter.py", 

64 "ollama_adapter.py", 

65 "prompt_normalizer.py", 

66 "rag_engine.py", 

67 ], 

68 "description": "AI model compatibility layer", 

69 }, 

70 # Accessibility features 

71 "accessibility": { 

72 "files": [ 

73 "__init__.py", 

74 "wcag_auditor.py", 

75 "dyslexia_formatter.py", 

76 "adhd_optimizer.py", 

77 "autism_preset.py", 

78 "sensory_customizer.py", 

79 ], 

80 "description": "Neurodivergent-first accessibility tools", 

81 }, 

82 # Knowledge graphs 

83 "knowledge_graph": { 

84 "files": [ 

85 "__init__.py", 

86 "graph_builder.py", 

87 "sparql_query.py", 

88 "update_agent.py", 

89 ], 

90 "description": "Semantic knowledge graph management", 

91 }, 

92 # Research automation 

93 "live_research": { 

94 "files": [ 

95 "__init__.py", 

96 "research_crawler.py", 

97 "paper_indexer.py", 

98 "synthesis_engine.py", 

99 "doc_generator.py", 

100 "github_publisher.py", 

101 ], 

102 "description": "Automated research paper collection and synthesis", 

103 }, 

104 # Test suite 

105 "tests": { 

106 "files": [ 

107 "__init__.py", 

108 "test_lexer.py", 

109 "test_parser.py", 

110 "test_backends.py", 

111 "test_ai_gateway.py", 

112 "test_accessibility.py", 

113 "test_integration.py", 

114 ], 

115 "description": "Comprehensive test suite", 

116 }, 

117 # Example programs 

118 "examples": { 

119 "files": ["hello_world.hc", "fibonacci.hc", "game_loop.hc", "quantum_demo.hc"], 

120 "description": "Example HyperCode programs", 

121 }, 

122 # Documentation 

123 "docs": { 

124 "files": [ 

125 "LANGUAGE_SPEC.md", 

126 "AI_COMPAT.md", 

127 "ACCESSIBILITY.md", 

128 "ARCHITECTURE.md", 

129 "CONTRIBUTING.md", 

130 ], 

131 "description": "Complete documentation", 

132 }, 

133 # GitHub workflows 

134 ".github/workflows": { 

135 "files": ["ci.yml", "cd.yml", "research.yml", "security.yml"], 

136 "description": "GitHub Actions CI/CD workflows", 

137 }, 

138} 

139 

140# Root-level files to create 

141ROOT_FILES = [ 

142 "Dockerfile", 

143 "docker-compose.yml", 

144 "requirements.txt", 

145 "requirements-dev.txt", 

146 ".releaserc", 

147 "setup.py", 

148 ".pre-commit-config.yaml", 

149 "healthcheck.sh", 

150] 

151 

152 

153def create_directories(): 

154 """Create all required directories.""" 

155 print("📁 Creating directory structure...") 

156 

157 # Create main package directories 

158 for directory in PROJECT_STRUCTURE: 

159 path = Path(directory) 

160 path.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True) 

161 (path / "__init__.py").touch() # Ensure each directory is a Python package 

162 

163 # Additional directories 

164 directories = [ 

165 "tests", 

166 "examples", 

167 "docs", 

168 ".github/workflows", 

169 "scripts", 

170 "templates", 

171 "notebooks/research", 

172 ] 

173 

174 for directory in directories: 

175 path = Path(directory) 

176 path.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True) 

177 

178 # Create README and other root files 

179 create_root_files() 

180 

181 print("✅ Directory structure created") 

182 

183 

184def create_python_files(): 

185 """Create all Python files with proper docstrings and structure.""" 

186 print("📝 Generating Python files...") 

187 

188 # Current year for license headers 

189 current_year = datetime.now().year 

190 

191 # License header template 

192 license_header = f"""# Copyright {current_year} {AUTHOR} 

193# 

194# Licensed under the {LICENSE} License (the "License"); 

195# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. 

196# You may obtain a copy of the License at 

197# 

198# https://opensource.org/licenses/{LICENSE} 

199# 

200# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software 

201# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, 

202# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. 

203# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and 

204# limitations under the License. 

205 

206""" 

207 

208 # Create package files 

209 for directory, config in PROJECT_STRUCTURE.items(): 

210 for filename in config["files"]: 

211 filepath = Path(directory) / filename 

212 

213 # Skip if file exists 

214 if filepath.exists(): 

215 continue 

216 

217 # Create file with appropriate content 

218 with open(filepath, "w", encoding="utf-8") as f: 

219 # Add license header 

220 f.write(license_header) 

221 

222 # Add module docstring 

223 if filename != "__init__.py": 

224 f.write( 

225 f'"""\n{config["description"]}\n\nFile: {filepath}\n"""\n\n' 

226 ) 

227 

228 # Add basic class/function template for non-empty files 

229 if filename not in ["__init__.py"]: 

230 module_name = filename[:-3] # Remove .py 

231 class_name = "".join( 

232 word.capitalize() for word in module_name.split("_") 

233 ) 

234 

235 if filename in ["lexer.py", "parser.py"]: 

236 f.write( 

237 f'class {class_name}:\n """{config["description"]}"""\n\n def __init__(self):\n pass\n' 

238 ) 

239 elif filename.endswith("_adapter.py"): 

240 f.write( 

241 f'class {class_name}Adapter:\n """Adapter for {module_name.replace("_", " ").title()} AI model."""\n\n def __init__(self, api_key=None):\n self.api_key = api_key\n' 

242 ) 

243 elif filename.endswith("_preset.py"): 

244 f.write( 

245 '"""Preset configurations for different neurotypes."""\n\n' 

246 ) 

247 f.write( 

248 'NEURO_PRESETS = {\n "dyslexia": {\n "font": "opendyslexic",\n "spacing": 1.2,\n "colors": "dark_theme"\n },\n "adhd": {\n "minimal_ui": True,\n "focus_mode": True,\n "distraction_free": True\n }\n}\n' 

249 ) 

250 

251 print("✅ Python files created with appropriate structure") 

252 

253 

254def create_example_files(): 

255 """Create example HyperCode files.""" 

256 print("\n📚 Creating example programs...") 

257 

258 examples = { 

259 "examples/hello_world.hc": """; HyperCode: Hello World 

260; Print 'H' (ASCII 72) 

261++++++++++ 

262++++++++++ 

263++++++++++ 

264++++++++++ 

265++++++++++ 

266++++++++++ 

267++++++++++ 

268++ 

269. 

270""", 

271 "examples/fibonacci.hc": """; HyperCode: Fibonacci Sequence 

272; Demonstrates loops and memory operations 

273 

274; Initialize 

275>++++++++++ 

276[ 

277 <+++++++++++ 

278 >- 

279] 

280<. 

281""", 

282 } 

283 

284 for file_path, content in examples.items(): 

285 path = Path(file_path) 

286 if not path.exists(): 

287 path.write_text(content) 

288 print(f" ✓ {file_path}") 

289 

290 

291def create_root_files(): 

292 """Create root-level configuration files with appropriate content.""" 

293 print("📄 Creating root configuration files...") 

294 

295 # Create README.md 

296 readme_content = f"""# 🚀 {PROJECT_NAME} 

297 

298{DESCRIPTION} 

299 

300## ✨ Features 

301 

302- **Neurodivergent-First Design**: Built with accessibility in mind 

303- **AI Compatibility**: Seamless integration with LLMs 

304- **Multi-Backend**: Compile to various targets (Python, JavaScript, WebAssembly, etc.) 

305- **Extensible**: Easy to add new language features and backends 

306 

307## 🚀 Quick Start 

308 

309```bash 

310# Clone the repository 

311git clone https://github.com/welshDog/{PROJECT_NAME}.git 

312cd {PROJECT_NAME} 

313 

314# Set up virtual environment 

315python -m venv venv 

316source venv/bin/activate # On Windows: venv\\Scripts\activate 

317 

318# Install dependencies 

319pip install -r requirements.txt 

320 

321# Run the HyperCode REPL 

322python -m hypercode 

323``` 

324 

325## 📚 Documentation 

326 

327Check out our [documentation](docs/README.md) for detailed usage instructions. 

328 

329## 🤝 Contributing 

330 

331We welcome contributions! Please see our [Contributing Guide](CONTRIBUTING.md) for details. 

332 

333## 📄 License 

334 

335This project is licensed under the {LICENSE} License - see the [LICENSE](LICENSE) file for details. 

336""" 

337 

338 # Create requirements.txt 

339 requirements_content = """# Core Dependencies 

340antlr4-python3-runtime>=4.13.1,<5.0.0 

341pydantic>=2.5.0,<3.0.0 

342 

343# AI & LLM Integrations 

344openai>=1.3.5,<2.0.0 

345anthropic>=0.7.1,<1.0.0 

346mistralai>=0.0.11,<1.0.0 

347ollama>=0.1.0,<1.0.0 

348 

349# Development 

350pytest>=7.4.0,<8.0.0 

351black>=23.7.0,<24.0.0 

352isort>=5.12.0,<6.0.0 

353mypy>=1.5.0,<2.0.0 

354flake8>=6.1.0,<7.0.0 

355""" 

356 

357 # Create .gitignore 

358 gitignore_content = """# Python 

359__pycache__/ 

360*.py[cod] 

361*$py.class 

362*.so 

363.Python 

364build/ 

365develop-eggs/ 

366dist/ 

367downloads/ 

368eggs/ 

369.eggs/ 

370lib/ 

371lib64/ 

372parts/ 

373sdist/ 

374var/ 

375wheels/ 

376*.egg-info/ 

377.installed.cfg 

378*.egg 

379 

380# Virtual Environment 

381venv/ 

382ENV/ 

383 

384# IDE 

385.idea/ 

386.vscode/ 

387*.swp 

388*.swo 

389 

390# Logs 

391logs/ 

392*.log 

393 

394# Local development 

395.env 

396.env.local 

397 

398# Build artifacts 

399build/ 

400dist/ 

401""" 

402 

403 # Create setup.py 

404 setup_content = """\"\"\" 

405HyperCode: Neurodivergent-First Programming Language 

406with AI Compatibility & Forgotten Language Resurrection 

407 

408Setup configuration for pip installation 

409\"\"\" 

410 

411from setuptools import setup, find_packages 

412from pathlib import Path 

413 

414# Read README 

415readme_file = Path(__file__).parent / "README.md" 

416long_description = readme_file.read_text(encoding="utf-8") if readme_file.exists() else "" 

417 

418setup( 

419 name="{PROJECT_NAME}", 

420 version="{VERSION}", 

421 author="{AUTHOR}", 

422 author_email="{AUTHOR_EMAIL}", 

423 description=( 

424 "A neurodivergent-first programming language " 

425 "with AI compatibility features" 

426 ), 

427 long_description=long_description, 

428 long_description_content_type="text/markdown", 

429 url=f"https://github.com/welshDog/{PROJECT_NAME}", 

430 packages=find_packages(exclude=["tests*"]), 

431 package_data={{"{PROJECT_NAME}": ["py.typed"]}}, 

432 include_package_data=True, 

433 python_requires=">=3.10", 

434 install_requires=[ 

435 "antlr4-python3-runtime>=4.13.1,<5.0.0", 

436 "pydantic>=2.5.0,<3.0.0", 

437 ], 

438 extras_require={{ 

439 "dev": [ 

440 "pytest>=7.4.0", 

441 "black>=23.7.0", 

442 "isort>=5.12.0", 

443 "mypy>=1.5.0", 

444 "flake8>=6.1.0", 

445 ], 

446 "ai": [ 

447 "openai>=1.3.5", 

448 "anthropic>=0.7.1", 

449 "mistralai>=0.0.11", 

450 "ollama>=0.1.0", 

451 ], 

452 }}, 

453 entry_points={{ 

454 "console_scripts": [ 

455 f"{PROJECT_NAME}={PROJECT_NAME}.cli:main", 

456 ], 

457 }}, 

458 classifiers=[ 

459 "Development Status :: 3 - Alpha", 

460 "Intended Audience :: Developers", 

461 "Intended Audience :: Science/Research", 

462 "License :: OSI Approved :: MIT License", 

463 "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.10", 

464 "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.11", 

465 "Topic :: Software Development :: Compilers", 

466 "Topic :: Software Development :: Interpreters", 

467 "Typing :: Typed", 

468 ], 

469) 

470""" 

471 

472 # Create files with content 

473 files_to_create = { 

474 "README.md": readme_content, 

475 "requirements.txt": requirements_content, 

476 ".gitignore": gitignore_content, 

477 "setup.py": setup_content, 

478 "LICENSE": f"""MIT License 

479 

480Copyright (c) {datetime.now().year} {AUTHOR} 

481 

482Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy 

483of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal 

484in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights 

485to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell 

486copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is 

487furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions: 

488 

489The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all 

490copies or substantial portions of the Software. 

491 

492THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR 

493IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, 

494FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE 

495AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER 

496LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, 

497OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE 

498SOFTWARE. 

499""", 

500 "pyproject.toml": r"""[build-system] 

501requires = ["setuptools>=42", "wheel"] 

502build-backend = "setuptools.build_meta" 

503 

504[tool.black] 

505line-length = 88 

506target-version = ['py310'] 

507include = '\.pyi?$' 

508 

509[tool.isort] 

510profile = "black" 

511line_length = 88 

512 

513[tool.mypy] 

514python_version = "3.10" 

515warn_return_any = true 

516warn_unused_configs = true 

517disallow_untyped_defs = true 

518check_untyped_defs = true 

519no_implicit_optional = true 

520 

521[tool.pytest.ini_options] 

522testpaths = ["tests"] 

523python_files = "test_*.py" 

524addopts = "-v --cov=hypercode --cov-report=term-missing" 

525""", 

526 } 

527 

528 # Create each file with its content 

529 for filename, content in files_to_create.items(): 

530 if not Path(filename).exists(): 

531 with open(filename, "w", encoding="utf-8") as f: 

532 f.write(content) 

533 

534 # Make setup.py executable 

535 if os.name != "nt": # Not needed on Windows 

536 os.chmod("setup.py", os.stat("setup.py").st_mode | stat.S_IEXEC) 

537 

538 print("✅ Root configuration files created") 

539 

540 

541def create_healthcheck(): 

542 """Create the healthcheck script for Docker.""" 

543 print("🔍 Creating healthcheck script...") 

544 

545 scripts_dir = Path("scripts") 

546 scripts_dir.mkdir(exist_ok=True) 

547 

548 healthcheck_path = scripts_dir / "healthcheck.sh" 

549 

550 if not healthcheck_path.exists(): 

551 healthcheck_content = """#!/bin/sh 

552# Health check for HyperCode services 

553 

554# Exit immediately if a command exits with a non-zero status 

555set -e 

556 

557# Check if the API server is running 

558if ! curl -sSf http://localhost:8000/health > /dev/null; then 

559 echo "Health check failed: API server is not responding" 

560 exit 1 

561fi 

562 

563# Check if required services are running 

564# Example: Check if Redis is accessible 

565# if ! redis-cli ping > /dev/null; then 

566# echo "Health check failed: Redis is not accessible" 

567# exit 1 

568# fi 

569 

570echo "All services are healthy" 

571exit 0 

572""" 

573 with open(healthcheck_path, "w", encoding="utf-8") as f: 

574 f.write(healthcheck_content) 

575 

576 # Make the script executable (Unix-like systems) 

577 if os.name != "nt": 

578 healthcheck_path.chmod(0o755) 

579 

580 print("✅ Healthcheck script created") 

581 

582 

583def print_summary(): 

584 """Print summary of created structure.""" 

585 print("\n✨ Project scaffolding complete! 🎉\n") 

586 

587 # Project structure summary 

588 print("📁 Project Structure:") 

589 print("├── hypercode/ # Main package") 

590 for directory, config in PROJECT_STRUCTURE.items(): 

591 print(f"│ ├── {directory.ljust(18)} # {config['description']}") 

592 

593 # Additional directories 

594 print("├── tests/ # Test suite") 

595 print("├── examples/ # Example HyperCode programs") 

596 print("├── docs/ # Documentation") 

597 print("├── scripts/ # Utility scripts") 

598 print("└── .github/workflows/ # GitHub Actions workflows\n") 

599 

600 # Next steps 

601 print("🚀 Next Steps:") 

602 print("1. Set up your development environment:") 

603 print(" python -m venv venv") 

604 print(" source venv/bin/activate # On Windows: venv\\Scripts\\activate") 

605 print( 

606 " pip install -e '.[dev,ai]' # Install in development mode with all extras\n" 

607 ) 

608 

609 print("2. Run the tests:") 

610 print(" pytest -v\n") 

611 

612 print("3. Start the development server:") 

613 print(" python -m hypercode.cli\n") 

614 

615 print("4. Open your browser to http://localhost:8000\n") 

616 

617 print("💡 Tip: Run 'make help' to see available development commands") 

618 print("🔧 Happy coding! 🚀\n") 

619 

620 

621def main(): 

622 """Main scaffolding function.""" 

623 try: 

624 print("🚀 Starting HyperCode project setup...\n") 

625 

626 # Create the project structure 

627 create_directories() 

628 create_python_files() 

629 create_example_files() 

630 create_healthcheck() 

631 

632 # Print success message and next steps 

633 print("\n" + "=" * 50) 

634 print("✅ Project setup completed successfully!") 

635 print("=" * 50 + "\n") 

636 

637 print_summary() 

638 

639 return 0 

640 except KeyboardInterrupt: 

641 print("\n\n❌ Setup cancelled by user") 

642 return 1 

643 except Exception as e: 

644 print(f"\n❌ Error during setup: {str(e)}", file=sys.stderr) 

645 import traceback 

646 

647 traceback.print_exc() 

648 return 1 

649 

650 

651if __name__ == "__main__": 

652 sys.exit(main())
